@philwalter1058 We articulate our Desired Effects as 1st, 2nd and 3rd Order. Links Mil Endstate & targeting Capability Will & Understanding
@philwalter1058 i still think objectives lead to effects rather than the other way around. Hierarchy: Desired Effects, Objective, Tasks
@CarlPrinetweets issue with COCOMs is they blend Op and Strat levels. Good argument for a proper Strat JS and relegate COCOMs to Op-level.
@CarlPrinetweets with CJTF HQ's running them. And component HQs below them.
@CarlPrinetweets large staff is one issue. The fact not all COCOM's are created equal is the other. PACOM runs on fumes compared to CENTCOM

@NKFinney @WarInstitute 4/4 "enabled army to be served by exceptionally small no. of staff officers and thus economic and inelaborate HQ"
@NKFinney @WarInstitute 3/3 "emphasis on the unique importance of a well-trained, integrated staff, preserved as a unit"
@NKFinney @WarInstitute 2/4"must be able to respond to battle and a commander's will in battle like a brain and nervous system"
@NKFinney @WarInstitute Rommel Bio: "staffs should be formed as self-sufficient cells of individuals understanding each other's methods" 1/4
@NKFinney @WarInstitute JS must be truly joint as well. Not JArmy with a couple of token seniors from the other services.
@NKFinney @WarInstitute therefore Domain (service) staff small to run force after next. All else,current and future force, = JS ?
@NKFinney @WarInstitute domains are a vector through which we generate effects in the Op Enviro. #multidomainisjustjointops
@NKFinney @WarInstitute To me it is the same as focus on domains. Justifying budgets, projects and legacies rather than joint effectiveness
@NKFinney @WarInstitute reading biography of Rommel ATM. Great quote ... "large staff generally = poor Army"
@NKFinney @WarInstitute can be argued we have exactly the same problem ( on a much smaller scale)
@NKFinney @WarInstitute my take that is the issue ... too many GS. A single JS directing COCOMs and Services. #structurelikewefight #joint
